text:
Proposed masks (1/3)

In the beginning of the annotation process, the software is proposing different masks
on which you have to decide whether it is a GOOD mask or a BAD mask.
This is done by clicking the respective buttons or keys ('good mask (n)', 'bad mask (m)').

The proposed masks are indicated by a green conotour on the top-right and bottom-right view.
To undo your last decision click the 'back(b)' button or press key 'b' on the keyboard.

In order to navigate in the images, you can left-click, drag and zoom whith the mouse wheel.
This can be done in any of the four views, they will all move synchronously.
Zooming in will help you to judge the maize kernels.

Now during the tutorial, feel free to test all the functionalities you have been introduced to.
During the tutorial there is no need to annotate all GOOD kernels. Once you feel
comfortable with the current tool, click the green 'Next' button.
If anything is unclear, do not hesitate to ask any questions.

Click 'Close' to start trying the tool.
